html:
9.4.18  9:54 pm   Hey Bill! I love your stuff. Do you mind talking a little bit about your writing process  and how you piece together your music?


8.26.18  8:34 am
6.27.18  8:43 am
5.23.18  7:11 am
2.25.18  2:41 pm
1.26.18  9:10 pm
1.17.18  8:42 pm
1.18.18  11:10 am
10.10.17  2:23 am
10.5.17  6:59 pm
6.15.17  9:30 am
6.15.17  1:20 am
5.30.17  2:11 pm
5.8.17  8:28 am
1.15.17  10:41 am
embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201808260834

8.26.18  8:34 am   What is your songwriting process

     touch the door and then do a run through. then find and answer the questions. always use metronome once tempo is finalized, to avoid what i call a 'tempo crisis' when writing

      (do you start
with melodies or lyrics first)?

     absolutely not


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201806270843

6.27.18  8:43 am   what instrument do your songs usually start the writing process on?

     i only write with 1 instrument, just a plain keyboard/rhodes sound. (and voice)


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201805230711

5.23.18  7:11 am   Explain your songwriting process. Do you sit down with intent or is it more of a spontaneous thing?

     there are 2 halves to songwriting. part 1 is getting the original idea from nowhere, which can happen on a deliberate idea generating session or the ideas may fall on my head randomly at other times. part 2, usually at a different time, is selecting one and taking care of it to completion


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201802251441

2.25.18  2:41 pm   When you write music do you plan it all out before recording or make it up as you're recording? I get the feeling it's a little of both for you.

     the content is firmly written ahead of time. details as to how to execute it are worked out in the recording session. the lyric/melody, chords, and exact tempo are all firmly established in the writing process, before i even touch the recording. all other instrumental details, such as which sounds to use, and most of the auxiliary instrumental fills and riffs in between the vocals, that would be worked out in the recording process, with some exceptions


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201801262110

1.26.18  9:10 pm   What is your songwriting process?

     i can't tell you


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201801172042

1.17.18  8:42 pm   do u write sheet music specifically for the videos these days

     i don't usually put it on paper any more, in the digital age


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201801181110

1.18.18  11:10 am   1.17.18  8:42 pm    Yes but do you use notation software during. the writing process? Partially? For certain sections only that are more complex?

     no, actually i think notation software is even harder than handwriting, because programs can be stubborn about how to format it and you have to bend over backwards to get it to look the way you want. now a days i just use memo recordings and text files to explain and demo the ideas with all the relevant details


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201710100223

10.10.17  2:23 am   Could you show us your writing process sometime?

     sure


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201710051859

10.5.17  6:59 pm   what if you could automate your song writing process? like plug your old songs in a neural network and let it create new songs, all of them original but following your style.

     i think you got the game backwards there

      That way you could release hundreds of songs every day, leaving you free to focus on automating video creating and then you could even make a "history of" video generator that could do 11 months of work in like 11 seconds

     i think you might be completely missing the point of what i'm doing


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201706150930

6.15.17  9:30 am   What part of the song-writing process takes the longest for you (excluding recording, editing, mixing, etc) Once you have a basic melody/chord sequence in mind are you able to come up with a full arrangement pretty quickly?

     the full arrangement is not included in the songwriting process. for me that happens when i record it


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201706150120

6.15.17  1:20 am   have you considered combining some of the song ideas on your list to get through it more effectively? i mean, if they were deemed worthy to write down for posterity, they're certainly already good ideas and concepts, and putting these ideas together might also streamline the writing process a bit

     in my experience, combining songs is not a good strategy. each song has its own very unique needs and it is important to consider exactly what that song needs in order to make it the strongest song. combining 2 halfwritten songs would be kind of like combining 2 half built houses and hoping it makes sense. although i suppose it may work for some people, and i think that's great. the last time i revealed here that i don't combine songs someone got mad at me. so it is important to emphasize the fact that other people may have success in doing that but it is not something that i think makes sense for me


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201705301411

5.30.17  2:11 pm   contd 5.29.17 3:41 pm so what happened in 2009 that made you realize that anything is possible and kickstarted your writing process? anything meaningful or just a random thought in your brain?

     i guess i had just been working my way toward writing for so long, and in so many ways, and felt so overwhelmed, there was no other route to take. it's kind of like you are circling around the outside of a house, trying to look for the best way in. you know there has to be a way in, but you just can't decide which way is the best way in. eventually you just have to stop circling and bash one of the walls in. surely you are strong enough now, from all the exercise you've gotten while circling the building for so long

     also, these songs that you have written but not recorded, how fleshed out are they? like do you have all the lyrics and all the notation done and just left to be recorded

     there are ones of every % complete, from 1 to 100

     or is it just lyrics/just music, etc?

     the lyrics and music are always together. at least that's the way i do it


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201705080828

5.8.17  8:28 am   at what point in the song writing process do you usually decide on a name

     whenever it becomes obvious. or if it does not become obvious by the end, then i will have to figure something out


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201701151041

1.15.17  10:41 am   Do you believe that your songwriting process is different from that of most people? If so, in what ways?

     every time i do it slightly differently. and every other person does it slightly differently each time, and also different from the way that other people do it each time, which is also different each time. i hope that makes sense
